 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>Ref: <span class="line"><!---->Ref: <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<!----></a><br><br>Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<span class="line"><!---->Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<!----></span><br><br>Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <span class="line"><!---->Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <!----></span><br><br>Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<span class="line"><!---->Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<!----></span><br><br>Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<span class="line"><!---->Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<!----></span><br><br>I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<span class="line"><!---->I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<span class="line"><!---->// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<!----></span><br>//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<span class="line"><!---->//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<!----></span><br>let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<span class="line"><!---->let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<!----></span><br><br>if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<span class="line"><!---->if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<!----></span><br><br>POC Steps:<span class="line"><!---->POC Steps:<!----></span><br>1. Open the Below Html File<span class="line"><!---->1. Open the Below Html File<!----></span><br>2. Click on the Save Image Button<span class="line"><!---->2. Click on the Save Image Button<!----></span><br>3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<span class="line"><!---->3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<!----></span><br>4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<span class="line"><!---->4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<!----></span><br><br>Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<span class="line"><!---->Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          asully@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          drubery@chromium.org

          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Blink&gt;Storage&gt;FileSystem
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<span class="line"><!---->This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<span class="line"><!---->We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<!----></span><br><br>See <span class="line"><!---->See <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which elaborates on this a bit more<span class="line"><!----> which elaborates on this a bit more<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Setting Pri-1 to match security severity Medium. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-1 to match security severity Medium. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Would you mind giving me access to <span class="line"><!---->Would you mind giving me access to <!----></span>issue 1407050<span class="line"><!---->issue 1407050<!----></span>? <span class="line"><!---->? <!----></span><br><br>As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<span class="line"><!---->As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<!----></span><br><br>Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<!----></a><br>Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<!----></a><br><br>As <span class="line"><!---->As <!----></span>crbug.com/1150810#c9<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1150810#c9" title="Security: File System Access API - getFileHandle() allowing to save .lnk files"><!---->crbug.com/1150810#c9<!----></a> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <span class="line"><!----> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<!----></a><br><br>That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<span class="line"><!---->That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

         * is disabled for this component.

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;

        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;

        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);

          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

        }
        .issue-header-container {

          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;

        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);

        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);

            border: 0;
          }
        }

              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }

          }

          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          </chops-button>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1405665: Security: Restricted Dangerous Extension (.local) Download Bypass
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1405665: Security: Restricted Dangerous Extension (.local) Download Bypass
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      ameen...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/124822455" title="ameen...@gmail.com"><!---->ameen...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      ameen...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->ameen...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>Ref: <span class="line"><!---->Ref: <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<!----></a><br><br>Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<span class="line"><!---->Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<!----></span><br><br>Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <span class="line"><!---->Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <!----></span><br><br>Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<span class="line"><!---->Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<!----></span><br><br>Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<span class="line"><!---->Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<!----></span><br><br>I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<span class="line"><!---->I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<span class="line"><!---->// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<!----></span><br>//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<span class="line"><!---->//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<!----></span><br>let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<span class="line"><!---->let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<!----></span><br><br>if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<span class="line"><!---->if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<!----></span><br><br>POC Steps:<span class="line"><!---->POC Steps:<!----></span><br>1. Open the Below Html File<span class="line"><!---->1. Open the Below Html File<!----></span><br>2. Click on the Save Image Button<span class="line"><!---->2. Click on the Save Image Button<!----></span><br>3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<span class="line"><!---->3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<!----></span><br>4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<span class="line"><!---->4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<!----></span><br><br>Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<span class="line"><!---->Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<span class="line"><!---->This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<span class="line"><!---->We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<!----></span><br><br>See <span class="line"><!---->See <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which elaborates on this a bit more<span class="line"><!----> which elaborates on this a bit more<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Would you mind giving me access to <span class="line"><!---->Would you mind giving me access to <!----></span>issue 1407050<span class="line"><!---->issue 1407050<!----></span>? <span class="line"><!---->? <!----></span><br><br>As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<span class="line"><!---->As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<!----></span><br><br>Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<!----></a><br>Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<!----></a><br><br>As <span class="line"><!---->As <!----></span>crbug.com/1150810#c9<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1150810#c9" title="Security: File System Access API - getFileHandle() allowing to save .lnk files"><!---->crbug.com/1150810#c9<!----></a> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <span class="line"><!----> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<!----></a><br><br>That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<span class="line"><!---->That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        OP, usually you'd be right - it seems like a bug that one file type is the only one that's on one blocklist but not another. Please see <span class="line"><!---->OP, usually you'd be right - it seems like a bug that one file type is the only one that's on one blocklist but not another. Please see <!----></span>comment 14<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c14"><!---->comment 14<!----></a> for why .local files are intentionally not blocklisted in this specific case<span class="line"><!----> for why .local files are intentionally not blocklisted in this specific case<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        >If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). <span class="line"><!---->&gt;If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). <!----></span><br><br>The above is one fron your <span class="line"><!---->The above is one fron your <!----></span>comment14<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c14"><!---->comment14<!----></a>. if this is the point decided to not fix the extension. then via download also we can download a malicious dll (or) someother thing so there is no point in fix the same in other places<span class="line"><!---->. if this is the point decided to not fix the extension. then via download also we can download a malicious dll (or) someother thing so there is no point in fix the same in other places<!----></span><br><br>People aware of the dll/exe file so they cannot be trick to execute this much easier. but in the context of .local people much not aware of this and they didn't need to invoke the files it will be auto invoked during some other executable execution<span class="line"><!---->People aware of the dll/exe file so they cannot be trick to execute this much easier. but in the context of .local people much not aware of this and they didn't need to invoke the files it will be auto invoked during some other executable execution<!----></span><br><br>the same is what fixed in other places.             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);

          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }

          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
<a class="__crdxFeedbackButton" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/monorail/issues/entry?template=Online%20Feedback"></a></body>


      
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;

    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);

                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
