                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open issue in new tab<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>Ref: <span class="line"><!---->Ref: <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<!----></a><br><br>Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<span class="line"><!---->Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<!----></span><br><br>Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <span class="line"><!---->Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <!----></span><br><br>Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<span class="line"><!---->Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<!----></span><br><br>Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<span class="line"><!---->Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<!----></span><br><br>I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<span class="line"><!---->I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<span class="line"><!---->// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<!----></span><br>//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<span class="line"><!---->//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<!----></span><br>let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<span class="line"><!---->let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<!----></span><br><br>if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<span class="line"><!---->if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<!----></span><br><br>POC Steps:<span class="line"><!---->POC Steps:<!----></span><br>1. Open the Below Html File<span class="line"><!---->1. Open the Below Html File<!----></span><br>2. Click on the Save Image Button<span class="line"><!---->2. Click on the Save Image Button<!----></span><br>3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<span class="line"><!---->3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<!----></span><br>4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<span class="line"><!---->4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<!----></span><br><br>Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<span class="line"><!---->Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<span class="line"><!---->This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      1301310<a id="bugLink" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310"><!---->1301310<!----></a><mr-issue-link projectname="chromium" text="1301310"></mr-issue-link>
          
          
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Duplicate
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Mergedinto:</strong>
          <!---->
            <mr-issue-link projectname="chromium" text="1301310"></mr-issue-link>
          <!---->
          
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<span class="line"><!---->We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<!----></span><br><br>See <span class="line"><!---->See <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which elaborates on this a bit more<span class="line"><!----> which elaborates on this a bit more<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        There is some misunderstanding in your side.<span class="line"><!---->There is some misunderstanding in your side.<!----></span><br><br>Im not Reporting about .exe / .bat files, The extension whiich i reported is usually prevented by chrome on default.<span class="line"><!---->Im not Reporting about .exe / .bat files, The extension whiich i reported is usually prevented by chrome on default.<!----></span><br><br>In my method also other 2 extensions .lnk/.url are blocked but the .local is missed which is usually handled in chrome by default but it is missed.<span class="line"><!---->In my method also other 2 extensions .lnk/.url are blocked but the .local is missed which is usually handled in chrome by default but it is missed.<!----></span><br><br>If the .lnk/.url are blocked this .local extension should also be blocked<span class="line"><!---->If the .lnk/.url are blocked this .local extension should also be blocked<!----></span><br><br>Hope you understand the issue. Waiting for your update.<span class="line"><!---->Hope you understand the issue. Waiting for your update.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Would you mind giving me access to <span class="line"><!---->Would you mind giving me access to <!----></span>issue 1407050<span class="line"><!---->issue 1407050<!----></span>? <span class="line"><!---->? <!----></span><br><br>As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<span class="line"><!---->As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<!----></span><br><br>Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<!----></a><br>Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<!----></a><br><br>As <span class="line"><!---->As <!----></span>crbug.com/1150810#c9<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1150810#c9" title="Security: File System Access API - getFileHandle() allowing to save .lnk files"><!---->crbug.com/1150810#c9<!----></a> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <span class="line"><!----> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<!----></a><br><br>That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<span class="line"><!---->That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

          width: 100%;

          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);

          min-width: 256px;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1405665%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D1100" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1405665%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D1100%252526ust%25253D1703400807907414%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw09ebrd2S326LvR0bO5EAdq%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>Ref: <span class="line"><!---->Ref: <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<!----></a><br><br>Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<span class="line"><!---->Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<!----></span><br><br>Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <span class="line"><!---->Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <!----></span><br><br>Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<span class="line"><!---->Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<!----></span><br><br>Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<span class="line"><!---->Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<!----></span><br><br>I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<span class="line"><!---->I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<span class="line"><!---->// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<!----></span><br>//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<span class="line"><!---->//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<!----></span><br>let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<span class="line"><!---->let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<!----></span><br><br>if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<span class="line"><!---->if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<!----></span><br><br>POC Steps:<span class="line"><!---->POC Steps:<!----></span><br>1. Open the Below Html File<span class="line"><!---->1. Open the Below Html File<!----></span><br>2. Click on the Save Image Button<span class="line"><!---->2. Click on the Save Image Button<!----></span><br>3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<span class="line"><!---->3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<!----></span><br>4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<span class="line"><!---->4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<!----></span><br><br>Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<span class="line"><!---->Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>

          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          asully@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          drubery@chromium.org
          
          <br>

          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Blink&gt;Storage&gt;FileSystem
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<span class="line"><!---->This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<span class="line"><!---->We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<!----></span><br><br>See <span class="line"><!---->See <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which elaborates on this a bit more<span class="line"><!----> which elaborates on this a bit more<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Setting Pri-1 to match security severity Medium. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<span class="line"><!---->Setting Pri-1 to match security severity Medium. If this is incorrect, please reset the priority. Sheriffbot won't make this change again.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Would you mind giving me access to <span class="line"><!---->Would you mind giving me access to <!----></span>issue 1407050<span class="line"><!---->issue 1407050<!----></span>? <span class="line"><!---->? <!----></span><br><br>As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<span class="line"><!---->As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<!----></span><br><br>Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<!----></a><br>Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<!----></a><br><br>As <span class="line"><!---->As <!----></span>crbug.com/1150810#c9<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1150810#c9" title="Security: File System Access API - getFileHandle() allowing to save .lnk files"><!---->crbug.com/1150810#c9<!----></a> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <span class="line"><!----> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<!----></a><br><br>That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<span class="line"><!---->That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

         * is disabled for this component.

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;

        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;

        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);

          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

        }
        .issue-header-container {

          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;

        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);

        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);

            border: 0;
          }
        }

              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>Ref: <span class="line"><!---->Ref: <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<!----></a><br><br>Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<span class="line"><!---->Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<!----></span><br><br>Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <span class="line"><!---->Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <!----></span><br><br>Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<span class="line"><!---->Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<!----></span><br><br>Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<span class="line"><!---->Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<!----></span><br><br>I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<span class="line"><!---->I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<span class="line"><!---->// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<!----></span><br>//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<span class="line"><!---->//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<!----></span><br>let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<span class="line"><!---->let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<!----></span><br><br>if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<span class="line"><!---->if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<!----></span><br><br>POC Steps:<span class="line"><!---->POC Steps:<!----></span><br>1. Open the Below Html File<span class="line"><!---->1. Open the Below Html File<!----></span><br>2. Click on the Save Image Button<span class="line"><!---->2. Click on the Save Image Button<!----></span><br>3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<span class="line"><!---->3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<!----></span><br>4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<span class="line"><!---->4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<!----></span><br><br>Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<span class="line"><!---->Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <div class="issue-diff">

          (was: Unconfirmed)

        This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<span class="line"><!---->This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1405665#c7">Comment 7<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jan 17, 2023, 3:01 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
