          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Duplicate
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
          Mergedinto:<strong><!---->Mergedinto:</strong>
          
            
      1301310<a id="bugLink" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310"><!---->1301310<!----></a><mr-issue-link projectname="chromium" text="1301310"></mr-issue-link>
          
          
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Duplicate
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Mergedinto:</strong>
          <!---->
            <mr-issue-link projectname="chromium" text="1301310"></mr-issue-link>
          <!---->
          
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<span class="line"><!---->We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<!----></span><br><br>See <span class="line"><!---->See <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which elaborates on this a bit more<span class="line"><!----> which elaborates on this a bit more<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

        <div>

        There is some misunderstanding in your side.<span class="line"><!---->There is some misunderstanding in your side.<!----></span><br><br>Im not Reporting about .exe / .bat files, The extension whiich i reported is usually prevented by chrome on default.<span class="line"><!---->Im not Reporting about .exe / .bat files, The extension whiich i reported is usually prevented by chrome on default.<!----></span><br><br>In my method also other 2 extensions .lnk/.url are blocked but the .local is missed which is usually handled in chrome by default but it is missed.<span class="line"><!---->In my method also other 2 extensions .lnk/.url are blocked but the .local is missed which is usually handled in chrome by default but it is missed.<!----></span><br><br>If the .lnk/.url are blocked this .local extension should also be blocked<span class="line"><!---->If the .lnk/.url are blocked this .local extension should also be blocked<!----></span><br><br>Hope you understand the issue.         Would you mind giving me access to <span class="line"><!---->Would you mind giving me access to <!----></span>issue 1407050<span class="line"><!---->issue 1407050<!----></span>? <span class="line"><!---->? <!----></span><br><br>As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<span class="line"><!---->As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<!----></span><br><br>Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<!----></a><br>Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<!----></a><br><br>As <span class="line"><!---->As <!----></span>crbug.com/1150810#c9<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1150810#c9" title="Security: File System Access API - getFileHandle() allowing to save .lnk files"><!---->crbug.com/1150810#c9<!----></a> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <span class="line"><!----> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<!----></a><br><br>That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<span class="line"><!---->That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

          <slot></slot>

      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by ameen...@gmail.com (Jan 8, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>Ref: <span class="line"><!---->Ref: <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<!----></a><br><br>Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<span class="line"><!---->Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<!----></span><br><br>Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <span class="line"><!---->Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <!----></span><br><br>Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<span class="line"><!---->Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<!----></span><br><br>Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<span class="line"><!---->Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<!----></span><br><br>I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<span class="line"><!---->I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<span class="line"><!---->// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<!----></span><br>//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<span class="line"><!---->//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<!----></span><br>let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<span class="line"><!---->let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<!----></span><br><br>if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<span class="line"><!---->if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<!----></span><br><br>POC Steps:<span class="line"><!---->POC Steps:<!----></span><br>1. Open the Below Html File<span class="line"><!---->1. Open the Below Html File<!----></span><br>2. Click on the Save Image Button<span class="line"><!---->2. Click on the Save Image Button<!----></span><br>3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<span class="line"><!---->3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<!----></span><br>4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<span class="line"><!---->4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<!----></span><br><br>Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<span class="line"><!---->Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          asully@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          drubery@chromium.org
          
          <br>

          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Blink&gt;Storage&gt;FileSystem
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<span class="line"><!---->This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<span class="line"><!---->We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<!----></span><br><br>See <span class="line"><!---->See <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which elaborates on this a bit more<span class="line"><!----> which elaborates on this a bit more<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Would you mind giving me access to <span class="line"><!---->Would you mind giving me access to <!----></span>issue 1407050<span class="line"><!---->issue 1407050<!----></span>? <span class="line"><!---->? <!----></span><br><br>As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<span class="line"><!---->As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<!----></span><br><br>Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<!----></a><br>Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<!----></a><br><br>As <span class="line"><!---->As <!----></span>crbug.com/1150810#c9<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1150810#c9" title="Security: File System Access API - getFileHandle() allowing to save .lnk files"><!---->crbug.com/1150810#c9<!----></a> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <span class="line"><!----> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<!----></a><br><br>That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<span class="line"><!---->That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>Ref: <span class="line"><!---->Ref: <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<!----></a><br><br>Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<span class="line"><!---->Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<!----></span><br><br>Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <span class="line"><!---->Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <!----></span><br><br>Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<span class="line"><!---->Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<!----></span><br><br>Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<span class="line"><!---->Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<!----></span><br><br>I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<span class="line"><!---->I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<span class="line"><!---->// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<!----></span><br>//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<span class="line"><!---->//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<!----></span><br>let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<span class="line"><!---->let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<!----></span><br><br>if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<span class="line"><!---->if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<!----></span><br><br>POC Steps:<span class="line"><!---->POC Steps:<!----></span><br>1. Open the Below Html File<span class="line"><!---->1. Open the Below Html File<!----></span><br>2. Click on the Save Image Button<span class="line"><!---->2. Click on the Save Image Button<!----></span><br>3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<span class="line"><!---->3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<!----></span><br>4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<span class="line"><!---->4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<!----></span><br><br>Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<span class="line"><!---->Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
          
      
        
          
          ShowDirectoryPicker -Dangerous Extension.mp4<b><!---->ShowDirectoryPicker -Dangerous Extension.mp4<!----></b>
          
        <div class="filename">
          
          <b><!---->ShowDirectoryPicker -Dangerous Extension.mp4<!----></b>

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          asully@chromium.org

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<span class="line"><!---->This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 7<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1405665#c7">Comment 7<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      asully@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1288192609" title="asully@chromium.org"><!---->asully@chromium.org<!----></a>
      asully@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->asully@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Tue, Jan 17, 2023, 3:01 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jan 17, 2023, 3:01 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1405665#c7">Comment 7<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jan 17, 2023, 3:01 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1405665#c7">Comment 7<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Jan 17, 2023, 3:01 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Duplicate
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
          Mergedinto:<strong><!---->Mergedinto:</strong>
          
            
      1301310<a id="bugLink" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310"><!---->1301310<!----></a><mr-issue-link projectname="chromium" text="1301310"></mr-issue-link>
          
          
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Duplicate
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Mergedinto:</strong>
          <!---->
            <mr-issue-link projectname="chromium" text="1301310"></mr-issue-link>
          <!---->
          
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<span class="line"><!---->We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<!----></span><br><br>See <span class="line"><!---->See <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which elaborates on this a bit more<span class="line"><!----> which elaborates on this a bit more<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1405665#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jan 23, 2023, 8:35 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1405665#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jan 23, 2023, 8:35 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Would you mind giving me access to <span class="line"><!---->Would you mind giving me access to <!----></span>issue 1407050<span class="line"><!---->issue 1407050<!----></span>? <span class="line"><!---->? <!----></span><br><br>As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<span class="line"><!---->As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<!----></span><br><br>Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<!----></a><br>Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<!----></a><br><br>As <span class="line"><!---->As <!----></span>crbug.com/1150810#c9<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1150810#c9" title="Security: File System Access API - getFileHandle() allowing to save .lnk files"><!---->crbug.com/1150810#c9<!----></a> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <span class="line"><!----> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<!----></a><br><br>That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<span class="line"><!---->That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>

              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>Ref: <span class="line"><!---->Ref: <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<!----></a><br><br>Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<span class="line"><!---->Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<!----></span><br><br>Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <span class="line"><!---->Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <!----></span><br><br>Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<span class="line"><!---->Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<!----></span><br><br>Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<span class="line"><!---->Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<!----></span><br><br>I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<span class="line"><!---->I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<span class="line"><!---->// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<!----></span><br>//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<span class="line"><!---->//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<!----></span><br>let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<span class="line"><!---->let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<!----></span><br><br>if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<span class="line"><!---->if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<!----></span><br><br>POC Steps:<span class="line"><!---->POC Steps:<!----></span><br>1. Open the Below Html File<span class="line"><!---->1. Open the Below Html File<!----></span><br>2. Click on the Save Image Button<span class="line"><!---->2. Click on the Save Image Button<!----></span><br>3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<span class="line"><!---->3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<!----></span><br>4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<span class="line"><!---->4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<!----></span><br><br>Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<span class="line"><!---->Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<span class="line"><!---->This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      1301310<a id="bugLink" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310"><!---->1301310<!----></a><mr-issue-link projectname="chromium" text="1301310"></mr-issue-link>
          
          
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Duplicate
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Mergedinto:</strong>
          <!---->
            <mr-issue-link projectname="chromium" text="1301310"></mr-issue-link>
          <!---->
          
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<span class="line"><!---->We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<!----></span><br><br>See <span class="line"><!---->See <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which elaborates on this a bit more<span class="line"><!----> which elaborates on this a bit more<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        There is some misunderstanding in your side.<span class="line"><!---->There is some misunderstanding in your side.<!----></span><br><br>Im not Reporting about .exe / .bat files, The extension whiich i reported is usually prevented by chrome on default.<span class="line"><!---->Im not Reporting about .exe / .bat files, The extension whiich i reported is usually prevented by chrome on default.<!----></span><br><br>In my method also other 2 extensions .lnk/.url are blocked but the .local is missed which is usually handled in chrome by default but it is missed.<span class="line"><!---->In my method also other 2 extensions .lnk/.url are blocked but the .local is missed which is usually handled in chrome by default but it is missed.<!----></span><br><br>If the .lnk/.url are blocked this .local extension should also be blocked<span class="line"><!---->If the .lnk/.url are blocked this .local extension should also be blocked<!----></span><br><br>Hope you understand the issue. Waiting for your update.<span class="line"><!---->Hope you understand the issue. Waiting for your update.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Would you mind giving me access to <span class="line"><!---->Would you mind giving me access to <!----></span>issue 1407050<span class="line"><!---->issue 1407050<!----></span>? <span class="line"><!---->? <!----></span><br><br>As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<span class="line"><!---->As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<!----></span><br><br>Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<!----></a><br>Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<!----></a><br><br>As <span class="line"><!---->As <!----></span>crbug.com/1150810#c9<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1150810#c9" title="Security: File System Access API - getFileHandle() allowing to save .lnk files"><!---->crbug.com/1150810#c9<!----></a> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <span class="line"><!----> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<!----></a><br><br>That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<span class="line"><!---->That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>Ref: <span class="line"><!---->Ref: <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<!----></a><br><br>Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<span class="line"><!---->Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<!----></span><br><br>Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <span class="line"><!---->Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <!----></span><br><br>Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<span class="line"><!---->Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<!----></span><br><br>Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<span class="line"><!---->Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<!----></span><br><br>I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<span class="line"><!---->I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<span class="line"><!---->// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<!----></span><br>//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<span class="line"><!---->//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<!----></span><br>let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<span class="line"><!---->let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<!----></span><br><br>if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<span class="line"><!---->if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<!----></span><br><br>POC Steps:<span class="line"><!---->POC Steps:<!----></span><br>1. Open the Below Html File<span class="line"><!---->1. Open the Below Html File<!----></span><br>2. Click on the Save Image Button<span class="line"><!---->2. Click on the Save Image Button<!----></span><br>3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<span class="line"><!---->3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<!----></span><br>4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<span class="line"><!---->4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<!----></span><br><br>Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<span class="line"><!---->Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Ameen Basha M K (Acknowledge my name with my profile/ mail id)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<span class="line"><!---->This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<span class="line"><!---->We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<!----></span><br><br>See <span class="line"><!---->See <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which elaborates on this a bit more<span class="line"><!----> which elaborates on this a bit more<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Would you mind giving me access to <span class="line"><!---->Would you mind giving me access to <!----></span>issue 1407050<span class="line"><!---->issue 1407050<!----></span>? <span picker: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<a class="undefined" target="_blank" <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<!----></a><br><br>As <span class="line"><!---->As <!----></span>crbug.com/1150810#c9<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1150810#c9" title="Security: File System Access API - getFileHandle() allowing to save .lnk files"><!---->crbug.com/1150810#c9<!----></a> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <span class="line"><!----> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<!----></a><br><br>That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<span class="line"><!---->That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by ameen...@gmail.com (Jan 8, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>Ref: <span class="line"><!---->Ref: <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1140417<!----></a><br><br>Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<span class="line"><!---->Hi Team. Downloading Malicious Extension via Browser is restricted on some phases eg: Chromium will replace the malicious Download extension (.lnk / .url / .local) to .download<!----></span><br><br>Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <span class="line"><!---->Kindly check the above attached Reference issue the same is addressed. <!----></span><br><br>Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<span class="line"><!---->Now i have Found a Alternate Way to Download the malicious Extension file via Browser(showDirectoryPicker method)<!----></span><br><br>Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<span class="line"><!---->Note: In this method already Few of the extension are arrested eg: .lnk, .url Saving file with this extension are not allowed, But .local is still possible<!----></span><br><br>I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<span class="line"><!---->I have attached the POC Video, HTML File Used in the Video, along with the error reference of saving .lnk / .url not allowed (this is just for reference of stating other extensions are filtered)<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Version 108.0.5359.125 (Official Build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 Updated to latest patches<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<span class="line"><!---->// ShowSaveFilePicker Method Example which will Replace the Dangerous Extension to .download but we can achieve the same with showDirectoryPicker<!----></span><br>//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<span class="line"><!---->//  Note: Other Extensions are Filtered in showDirectoryPicker eg: saving .lnk will throw Name error<!----></span><br>let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<span class="line"><!---->let a = await window.showSaveFilePicker({suggestedName:'abc.local'})<!----></span><br><br>if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<span class="line"><!---->if you run the above line in Browser Console it will prompt for Save console and once you click save it replace the Extension with .download instead of actual .local<!----></span><br><br>POC Steps:<span class="line"><!---->POC Steps:<!----></span><br>1. Open the Below Html File<span class="line"><!---->1. Open the Below Html File<!----></span><br>2. Click on the Save Image Button<span class="line"><!---->2. Click on the Save Image Button<!----></span><br>3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<span class="line"><!---->3. It will open the directorypicker, Choose actual directory in which you want to save<!----></span><br>4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<span class="line"><!---->4. Done. You will see the .local file in your Directory<!----></span><br><br>Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<span class="line"><!---->Note: I have used Double extension with space in between them to make people think the extension is different from the malicious one. In this case i used to show .jpg in Windows Explorer. but by checking the properties it shows as .local file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes.       <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          asully@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          drubery@chromium.org

          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Blink&gt;Storage&gt;FileSystem

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<span class="line"><!---->This appears to be using filesystem access to create files directly locally.<!----></span><br><br>I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<span class="line"><!---->I'm not sure what the expected model here is; do we attempt to block creation of files that we would normally block if the file was acquired via a download? My feeling here is the answer is "no, we do not attempt to block, because granting filesystem access like this is already a very powerful primitive".<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<span class="line"><!---->We're less restrictive with the files you can save once you have write access to a directory. The idea there is that we don't want to restrict, for example, sync clients from being able to sync/read/edit files which already exist on the machine that are potentially dangerous, but we're more restrictive if you're trying to download a new one<!----></span><br><br>See <span class="line"><!---->See <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1301310#c9<!----></a>,<span class="line"><!---->,<!----></span> which elaborates on this a bit more<span class="line"><!----> which elaborates on this a bit more<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Would you mind giving me access to <span class="line"><!---->Would you mind giving me access to <!----></span>issue 1407050<span class="line"><!---->issue 1407050<!----></span>? <span class="line"><!---->? <!----></span><br><br>As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<span class="line"><!---->As I mentioned above, we have different restrictions for the file picker vs. once the site has write access to a directory:<!----></span><br><br>Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions of files selected from the file picker: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_chooser.cc;l=287-297;drc=4e1b7bc33d42b401d7d9ad1dcba72883add3e2af<!----></a><br>Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <span class="line"><!---->Restrictions on extensions when creating files once you have directory write access: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;drc=8a27797c643fb0f2d9ae835f8d8b509e027c97e9;l=60<!----></a><br><br>As <span class="line"><!---->As <!----></span>crbug.com/1150810#c9<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1150810#c9" title="Security: File System Access API - getFileHandle() allowing to save .lnk files"><!---->crbug.com/1150810#c9<!----></a> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <span class="line"><!----> points out, "If we can edit/create files inside a folder then there are better ways to inject malware files" (than saving a .local file). That comment and the one above it is what I believe lead us to decide that it wasn't worthwhile to block .local files if you have write access to the directory: <!----></span>https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d"><!---->https://crsrc.org/c/content/browser/file_system_access/file_system_access_directory_handle_impl.cc;l=715-720;drc=2b1e6e02b9dcf0918250297f6efe11b60798339d<!----></a><br><br>That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<span class="line"><!---->That being said, I'm not an expert in how .local files can be used maliciously :) I'm happy to reconsider if we believe they're too dangerous to allow sites to create/edit/view even with write access to the directory<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        Convert issue to new template structure<h3 class="medium-heading">Convert issue to new template structure</h3>
        
          
            Pick a template: <label for="templateInput">Pick a template: </label>
            
              --Please choose a project template--<option value="">--Please choose a project template--</option>
              
                
                   Vpython Wheel Request
                <option value=" Vpython Wheel Request">
                   Vpython Wheel Request
                </option>
                
                  (test)(new) postmortem tracking bug
                <option value="(test)(new) postmortem tracking bug">
                  (test)(new) postmortem tracking bug
                </option>
                
                  Android Issue
                <option value="Android Issue">
                  Android Issue
                </option>
                
                  Audio/Video Communication Bugs
                <option value="Audio/Video Communication Bugs">
                  Audio/Video Communication Bugs
                </option>
                
                  Audio/Video Issue
                <option value="Audio/Video Issue">
                  Audio/Video Issue
                </option>
                
                  Broken Webpage
                <option value="Broken Webpage">

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
